text: What was the workaround?

I solved it by downloading the version of the library from github

pip install git+<https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-api-python.git>

this uninstalled the version HubSpot-api-client 7.5.0 and installed the beta version HubSpot-api-client-8.0.0b3 and there I can import SimplePublicObjectInputForCreate and use it

Dont feel great that Iâ€™m on the beta but luckily its a very small project
Is there anyone to answer my query from the team?
Yes I understand, but when I request a goal with a random ID, I don't get all the properties listed. How would I go about requesting only the available list, even if these have null values?
Yeah you'll want to use the schemas api for this
Thanks
This will usually tell you how the data is expected
but keep in mind that validation is only enforced if the property is changed in the UI
not through the API, a form, or workflows
If I want to know all validations and rules for each property in Deals or any other object properties then i have to use schema API?
Right?
Oh wait never mind, the post I was reading was old now I remember it will be enforced through the api starting june 24
Yes
Little annoying that these articles contradict each other:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog/upcoming-property-validations-rules-will-be-enforced-for-apis-and-integrations>
Running some tests on my end
okay
Hi team, how can I access via API the phone number of the associated contact of a deal?
Well after creating a property and testing it with the property and schemas api I don't see any reference to the validation rules

It shows up on the deal itself under contact.

I've tried to retrieve it calling the /v3/objects/deals API but no luck

Even HubSpot's internal property api doesn't return this info, every time you type a value into a property with validation it send a POST request to that particular properties validation endpoint to check if it's valid
This is definitely a needed change to the properties and schemas endpoint.
CC <@UD53A9UUR> what do you think?
i have made sure the team in charge is aware.  thanks for thing ping, carter
of course, really important especially because the validation error when you try and ping the api with a bad input doesn't tell you how to resend. Thanks Dennis really appreciate it
you will get an error that should describe what the validation problem is

```{

status: "error",

message: "Property values were not valid: 

[{"isValid":false,"message":"Enter only letters","error":"INVALID_ALPHA","name":"firstname"},{"isValid":false,"message":"Enter only letters","error":"INVALID_ALPHA","name":"lastname"}]",

correlationId: "11061cd3-cf3b-45f7-98d4-27f10a99ece6",

category: "VALIDATION_ERROR"

}```
example from the changelog
Yeah saw that but what if the field is ALPHA and length restricted?
it _should_ return both of those
Feels like it should return the regex for the validation
regardless, working with the team.  if we get something together to help here, i will make sure to update here as well as amend the changelog post
you're awesome

Is it possible to get the soonest available appointment on a meeting calendar using the API?

for a GET on `<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/deals/1234?properties=deal_currency_code,amount>`
you can choose which properties are returned with the `properties` query parameter
